description.narrative: - Project impacts: Preserving extensive linkages throughout the value chain; maintaining direct and indirect jobs; increasing availability of high-quality protein. - Market impacts: Supporting the development of a competitive export-oriented sector; improving market practices regarding energy and resource efficiency.

The proposed IFC investment consists of an A loan to Operadora y Procesadora de Productos Marinos Omarsa S.A. (Omarsa or the Company). Founded in the 1977s by the Vanoni family, Omarsa is one of the leading integrated shrimp producers and processors in Ecuador. The project involves the financing of part of the Companys capex plan for 2021, consisting of (i) investments on shrimp farms to optimize the feeding process (including solar-powered feeding machines) and on the revamping of water pumping systems and (ii) an expansion on the cold storage facility and shrimp freezing equipment at the Las Brisas plant (the Project). These investments will allow the Company to improve its efficiency, in a scenario of low shrimp prices which were significantly affected by the Covid pandemic. The proposed financing will provide relief to the Companys liquidity condition, which has an important portion of its debt concentrated in the short term.
